page.title: 02LLANNEFYDD - AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: {Llannefydd}is a small, quiet hamlet nesting on the slopes of the{Hiraethog highland. The village is made up of a church,shop,school,village hall, chapel,Hawk and Buckle Inn and 35 new and old houses. On the outskirts of the village is {Nefydd's Well}and there are many other wells in the area.{Saint Nefydd}lived here in the 6th century.Two km away on {Mynydd Y Gaer}stood a pre-Roman hill fort so people have lived here for thousands of years.From the top of the Hill there is a panoramic view of North Wales-the seaside towns of Rhyl and Prestatyn,Snowdonia,Hiraethog Hills and the Vale of Clwyd. The parish boundary follows the rivers Aled,Elwy and Meirchion for most of its path.Where the landscape is rugged sheep graze but on the lower fertile meadows there are many dairy farms.
